title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 July 2016 - XWiki
content:
<lkrejci> has joined #xwiki

08:50 <mbuschman> Good morning. Is anyone who knows about the CKEditor implementation awake yet?  
08:52 <mbuschman> (is there anyone besides mflorea?)  
09:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <mbuschman> has quit  
12:15 <acotiuga1> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <acotiuga> has quit  
12:25 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <ol-ow2> Hi, i've a docA contains object classZ, if i rename classZ as  classY, docA will have deprecated object :(. So how to rename a class without loose any data ? cjd tmortagne ?  
12:33 <cjd> database migration :(  
12:33 <ol-ow2> :(  
12:34 <ol-ow2> ok..  
12:34 <cjd> you can mysql it, but just living with the old name is probably a superior idea  
12:36 <ol-ow2> ok, or create a snippet which will check each doc with old classename and copy old data to the new class object  
12:37 <ol-ow2> another question (sorry)  
12:38 <ol-ow2> cjd: $doc.getxWikiClasses().get(0).name will give me alway the first classname alphabetically ordered or what ?  
12:40 <cjd> I don't know how the ordering works  
12:40 <ol-ow2> ok :) thanks  
12:41 <ol-ow2> in edit mode, it seems name order by ASC.. but with a get(index) i'm not sure :D  
12:41 <ol-ow2> anyway, thnks for your support  
13:01 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: class property are explicitely ordered, meaning you can give then the order you want so its not automatically sorted  
13:01 <tmortagne> s/then/them/  
13:02 <tmortagne> as for class rename yes, it does not automatically rename the class reference in object (something to improve) but that's something you can fix in related document with some script  
13:04 <tmortagne> to be fully clean it copy objects with old class name to objects with new class name, remove the old objects, save the document  
13:04 <tmortagne> \*it means

15:32 <polx> Hello XWiki experts, is there a preferred strategy to write extensions of the CKEditor? I don’t see this documented and will probably start into fiddling the produced webjars. Maybe there’s a better way...
